author: reidak49
title: the drifter
review: i wonder why do they call thok the drifter thok is my second favorite piraka he has that ice gun the webbed feet the glow in the dark teeth the light up eyes witch are not replacable and the zamor launcher this is still my second favorite set

author: Pepper
title: 3rd favorite Piraka
review:
I got this set for Christmas in 2006, and I thought he was so cool.On to the pros. and cons..

Pros.
cool Piraka
strong launcher
white and blue, awesome together
probably the coolest Bionicle weapon I own

Cons.
you can't change the batteries in his eyes
zamor spheres don't stay in launcher

author: Carl
title: BRILLIANT BIONICLE!
review: With the fiendish grin and spiky exoskeleton, Thok the treachorous Piraka's looks are enough to make anyones blood run cold. This set is awesome as! My third favourite Piraka. I really was not pleased with Reidak, so Wwhen I saw my bro had gotten Thok the awesome I thought no fair!

author: Gus_263
title: The frozen piraka
review: The white piraka have a double sided weapon including two pieces. The spine, one of the most simple, is one of the better. The light-up eyes, glow in the dark teeth, and some pieces same of other piraka are great to creations. The combination with vezok is great. The colors looks like a guy of ice.

author: BionicleBOOM
title: Best Piraka Out There
review:
Thok was my second Piraka, and is my favorite of the two I own (Vezok is the other one; I used to have Reidak).  See my review for Vezok; my message is still the same.  They're only clones of each other.  I wish Lego had made them a little more unique, like the Barraki and Toa Mahri.  Still, Thok is a good set.  I like his weapon with the blue thingy inserted inside.  It makes it look like a real freeze gun or something.  His eyes and teeth are also a good feature, as well as the first Zamor Sphere Launcher.  So let me get my ideas organized:

Pros:

Ice gun looks wicked

Zamor launcher

Teeth and Eyes

Grinning face (kinda goofy and emphasized)

Cons:

Rubber spine makes him hard to pose

Clone of the other Piraka

This is what I think of Thok.  He's a good set; worth keeping anyway.  BionicleBOOM signin' out.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Piraka) - Thok Review
review:
This is a cool figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has 32 pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This figure has 42 pieces and was 9 USD when it was on sale. The price per piece ratio was 21 cents per piece. I think it's a really good value for a figure like this.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't have to worry about stickers as well.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8905-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the hands, the legs, the feet and the head can be moved. On one hand we can see a gun and on the other hand we can see a launcher which shoots very well. What's also cool about the piraka figures is that the eyes can glow if you push the head. Another cool thing we get here is that the teeth glow in the dark. I really can't complain about this figure.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: Johnsmith1235
title: Thok definitely gives the impression of an ice BIONICLE. And his Ice gun is soooooooooo coooool!
review:
Thok's spines are the biggest (longest?) of the Piraka. He has A cool evil grin, and his dual action weapon is huge! Like the rest of the Piraka he also has light up eyes and A Zamor sphere launcher.

Pros

  • Big spines.
  • Nice build, easy and looks great!
  • Has A nice height of almost 8"!
  • Nice weapons.
  • Evil grin. (For A Piraka that's A good thing by the way).
  • Glow in the dark teeth

Cons

  • Cross piece in the head looks A little weird with the off white.
  • Socket pieces on the feet sometimes slip off the cross pins.
  • Poseability is limited on the head and arms because of the rubber spines.

 

All said and done Thok is pretty impressive, and playability is no issue. And whatever some people say, all the Piraka spines and heads are different.

This set is definitely worth it, and can be found easily on Bionicle Piraka Ebay. (Maybe on Amazon too, I don't know).
